text.0: indra when soma juices flow makes his mind pure and meet for lauds.
text.1: he gains the power that brings success for great is he.
text.2: in heavens first region in the seat of gods is he who brings success.
text.3: most glorious prompt to save who wins the waterfloods.
text.4: him to win strength have i invoked even indra mighty for the fray.
text.5: be thou most near to us for bliss a friend to aid.
text.6: indra song lover here for thee the worshippers libation flows.
text.7: rejoicing in this sacred grass thou shinest forth.
text.8: even now o indra give us that which pressing juice we crave of thee.
text.9: bring us wealth manifold which finds the light of heaven.
text.10: what time the zealous worshipper hath boldly sung his songs to thee.
text.11: like branches of a tree upgrows what they desire.
text.12: generate songs even as of old give car unto the singers call.
text.13: thou for the pious hast grown great at each carouse.
text.14: sweet strains that glorify him play like waters speeding down a slope.
text.15: yea him who in this song is called the lord of heaven.
text.16: yea who alone is called the lord the single ruler of the folk.
text.17: by worshippers seeking aid may he joy in the draught.
text.18: praise him the glorious skilled in song lord of the two victorious bays.
text.19: they seek the worshippers abode who bows in prayer.
text.20: put forth thy strength with dappled steeds come thou of mighty intellect.
text.21: with swift steeds to the sacrifice for tis thy joy.
text.22: grant wealth to those who praise thee lord of heroes mightiest indra give.
text.23: our princes everlasting fame and opulence.
text.24: i call thee when the sun is risen i call thee at the noon of day.
text.25: with thy carhorses indra come wellpleased to us.
text.26: speed forward hither come to us rejoice thee in the milky draught.
text.27: spin out the thread of ancient time as well is known.
text.28: if Śakra vṛtraslayer thou be far away or near to us.
text.29: or in the sea thou art the guard of soma juice.
text.30: let songs we sing and somadrops expressed by us make indra strong.
text.31: the tribes who bring oblations find delight in him.
text.32: him sages longing for his aid with offerings brought in eager haste.
text.33: him even as branches all mankind have made to grow.
text.34: at the trkadrukas the gods span sacrifice that stirred the mind.
text.35: may our songs strengthen him who still hath strengthened us.
text.36: when true to duty at due times the worshipper offers lauds to thee.
text.37: they call him purifier pure and wonderful.
text.38: that mind of rudra fresh and strong moves conscious in the ancient ways.
text.39: with reference whereto the wise have ordered this.
text.40: if thou elect to be my friend drink of this sacrificial juice.
text.41: by help whereof we may subdue all enemies.
text.42: o indra lover of the song when shall thy praiser be most blest.
text.43: when wilt thou grant us wealth in herds of kine and steeds.
text.44: and thy two highiylauded bays strong stallions draw thy car who art.
text.45: untouched by age most gladdening car for which we pray.
text.46: with ancient offerings we implore the young and strong whom many praise.
text.47: he from of old hath sat upon dear sacred grass.
text.48: wax miglity thou whom many laud for aids which Ṛṣis have extolled.
text.49: pour down for us abundant food and guard us well.
text.50: o indra caster of the stone thou helpest him who praises thee.
text.51: from sacrifice i send to thee a mindyoked hymn.
text.52: here yoking for the somadraught these horses sharers of thy feast.
text.53: thy bay steeds indra fraught with weal tb consent to come.
text.54: attendants on thy glory let the rudras roar assent to thee.
text.55: and all the marut companies come tothe feast.
text.56: these his victorious followers bold in the heavens the place they love.
text.57: leagued in the heart of sacrifice as well we know.
text.58: that we may long behold the light what time the ordered rite proceeds.
text.59: he duly measures as he views the sacrifice.
text.60: o indra strong is this thy car and strong are these bay steeds of thine.
text.61: o Śatakratu thou art strong strong is our call.
text.62: strong is the pressstone strong thy joy strong is the flowing soma juice.
text.63: strong is the rite thou furtherest strong is our call.
text.64: as strong i call on thee the strong o thunderer with thy thousand aids.
text.65: for thou hast won the hymn of praise strong is our call.
